This may well be why certain animals seem to vacate an area prior to eruption, earthquake and tidal wave, they could be more sensitive to these audio ranges/pressure changes?

Though that particular phenomime is being studied to see if its a fault in humans recollection after an event,
Most people talk about their dogs acting weird after an event nor prior for example, so it may be humans seeing a pattern where there isn't one.

Addendum, we should listen to the sea, if we can get an pre-emptive warning system for tidal waves, it could save lives.

Let me get this straight; are you saying that scientists are starting to figure out that anywhere up to 50 cubic kilometres of molten magma & rock debris beginning to crack through the very crust of the Earth itself might have a distinctive sound to it?

Why ever on Earth did they assume the reason was for birds & deer bolting away from any area long before we humans actually notice. The ultra high noice would be be overwhelmingly excruciating the be surrounded by; you don’t hear it so much as it evidently sucks away the sound from everything else; of course birds flea before an eruption.

Really, did they assume it was part of certain critters like the shark & the platypus have electro-receptors that might give them the first warning? I can’t imagine, animals clear places that are about to be hit with natural disasters because they hear trouble coming a mile away.
